page.title: 15ALWYN HOUSE
page.content: {Alwyn House in Ceres,is a centre that {assesses visually handicapped people {for future employment.}The house holds sixteen trainees between the ages of sixteen and mid-fifties.The course lasts up to twelve weeks.The centre is {one of only two in Great Britain.}The centre assesses skills in engineering, woodwork,commercial and braille.After the course further training is available in workshops for the blind. The trainees also receive mobility training which aims to give them independence in coping with busy streets.The centre is financed by {Manpower Services,and the Edinburgh {Society for the Welfare and Teaching {of the blind.}Most people who come for assessment have become blind as a result of illness or injury.
